meanings.definition: The quality or state of being fleeting or transient.
meanings.sent1: The fugitiveness of the butterfly's flight amazed the children.
meanings.sent2: The fugitiveness of happiness makes it important to cherish every moment.
meanings.sent3: The fugitiveness of time can sometimes feel like a mischievous game.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed with the fugitiveness of a shooting star.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the fugitiveness of the sunset in a breathtaking painting.

meanings.definition: The act of fleeing or escaping.
meanings.sent1: The fugitiveness of the criminal surprised the police officers.
meanings.sent2: The fugitiveness of the rabbit made it hard to catch.
meanings.sent3: The fugitiveness of the squirrel led to a comical chase around the park.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts raced with the fugitiveness of a wild horse.
meanings.sent5: The fugitiveness of the wind through the trees signaled an approaching storm.
